tooltip.action-type: Activates bonus whenever the given action types are matched.
tooltip.action-type-radio:
Selects if the action types are evaluated as a group or individually.

All: Bonuses will be applied only if all action types are matched.

Any: Bonuses will be applied if any action type is matched.
tooltip.agile: Grant dex to damage for attacks.
tooltip.alignment: Activates bonuses when targeting tokens with the chosen alignment.
tooltip.all: Activate bonuses for any action that can accept the bonus.
tooltip.ammo-attack: This attack bonus will be added on top of any other attack bonuses when using this ammo.
tooltip.ammo-damage: A typed damage bonus added when using this ammo.
tooltip.ammo-effect: When attacking with this arrow, also show this effect note.
tooltip.ammo-enhancement-stacks: For enhancement Bonuses that stack, such as Bane.
tooltip.armor-focus: Increase AC by 1 for chosen armor. Armor must be properly configured with Equipment Base Types.
tooltip.armor-focus-improved: Decrease ACP by 1 for chosen armor. Armor must be properly configured with Equipment Base Types.
tooltip.attack-crit-only: Whether or not this Attack Bonus should only apply to critical hit confirmation rolls.
tooltip.bane: Adds +2 enhancement bonus and +2d6 damage to Targeted attacks when targeting an actor with the chosen Creature Types.
tooltip.change-modification: Modify chosen change type. Like Fate's Favored, but you choose what happens.
tooltip.change-modification-formula: Formula and type to modify the specified change type.
tooltip.change-modification-set-type: Determines if the change modification will be set to or modified by the formula.
tooltip.condition: Activate bonuses when actor has condition.
tooltip.conditional-modifiers: Grants Conditional Modifiers to targeted actions.
tooltip.creature-type: Will be applied when current target has any of the chosen creature types.
tooltip.creature-subtype: Will be applied when current target has any of the chosen creature subtypes.
tooltip.crit-mult: Increase or Decrease the critical multiplier.
tooltip.crit-offset: Modify the critical threat range. This modification happens after Keen.
tooltip.crit: Modify the crit range and/or multiplier.
tooltip.damage: Add bonus damage to the targeted actions.
tooltip.damage-type: Bonuses will be applied to actions that deal the chosen damage type.
tooltip.dc: Modify the DC for spells and abilities.
tooltip.devastating-strike-improved: Adds crit confirm with Vitale Strikes
tooltip.dice-transform: Transform base damage for targeted actions.
tooltip.dice-transform-priority: Order for multiple transformations. Higher numbers will be processed first.
tooltip.effective-size: Formula input for increasing a sizeRoll formula's Effective Size. This is used for buffs like Lead Blades, Gravity Bow, etc.
tooltip.elemental-cl: Modify CL for spells with the chosen element.
tooltip.elemental-dc: Modify DC for spells with the chosen element.
tooltip.elemental-focus-greater: Further increase an element from Elemental Focus by +1 DC.
tooltip.enh: Modify an attack's or weapon's enhancement bonus.
tooltip.enh-stacks: Modify an attack or weapon's enhancement bonus.
tooltip.finesse-bonus: Use dex for attack rolls instead of strength.
tooltip.finesse-override: Add the finesse weapon property to an Item that doesn't normally have weapon properties.
tooltip.finesse-target: Activate bonuses for all finesse-able targets. This requires the weapon/attack to have the Finesse weapon property, be in the Natural Attack weapon group, or have the `finesse-override` boolean flag.
tooltip.footnote: Targeted attacks will include this footnote.
tooltip.fortune: Roll twice and take the better. Multiple bonuses stack.
tooltip.function: A custom function that's executed to determine what to target. See examples in documentation.
tooltip.function-player-label: Label shown to players when configured. Players will not be able to edit the function.
tooltip.furious-focus: Negate the attack penalty of power attack on the first attack made each round.
tooltip.has-boolean-flag: Activate bonuses based on whether a boolean flag is active.
tooltip.inspiration: Freely roll Inspiration for specified skills.
tooltip.inspiration-amazing: Increase Inspiration die by one step.
tooltip.inspiration-focused: Increase Inspiration die by one step for chosen skills.
tooltip.inspiration-tenacious: When rolling Inspiration, roll an extra die and keep the highest.
tooltip.inspiration-true: Can freely use Inspiration on all skills.
tooltip.is-target-within-range: Active when all targets are within a specified range.
tooltip.is-target-within-range-min: Activate bonuses whenever all targeted tokens are at least this far away.
tooltip.is-target-within-range-max: Activate bonuses whenever all targeted tokens are at most this far away.
tooltip.item: Apply bonuses when using these specific Items.
tooltip.martial-focus: +1 damage with chosen weapon group. Attacks and Weapons must be properly configured with weapon groups.
tooltip.maximize-damage: Maximize the damage rolls for the targeted abilities.
tooltip.misfortune: Roll twice and take the worse. Multiple bonuses stack.
tooltip.precise-shot: Negate penalty for shooting into melee.
tooltip.proficiency: Adds Proficiency for this item (usually needed alongside a Weapon Group override).
tooltip.ranged-increment-penalty: Modify the penalties associated with ranged weapon increments.
tooltip.ranged-increment-penalty-increment-penal: Modify the number of maximum range increments.
tooltip.ranged-increment-penalty-increment-range: Modify the range for each increment.
tooltip.roll-untrained: Marks skills as able to be rolled untrained.
tooltip.script-call: Configure Script Calls that are executed for the targeted actions. You can drag macros here as well.
tooltip.self: Apply bonuses to all actions on this same Item.
tooltip.skill-rank-override: Set skill rank for a chosen skill to a specific value. This is useful for an item such as a Headband of Vast Intellect.
tooltip.skill-rank-override-formula: Formula to set skill rank for chosen skill(s) to a specific value. This is useful for an item such as a Headband of Vast Intellect.
tooltip.skill-rank-override-selected: The skills to be overridden with the supplied formula.
tooltip.snake-sidewind: Use Sense Motive for critical confirmations when your maximum Sense Motive result is higher than your maximum attack roll.
tooltip.spell-school: Apply bonuses to spells of the chosen school(s).
tooltip.spell-subschool: Apply bonuses to spells of the chosen subschool(s).
tooltip.spell-specialization: Increase CL by 2 for a chosen spell from a school that you have Spell Focus for.
tooltip.spell: Apply bonuses for actions for these specific spells.
tooltip.spell-focus-greater: Further increase a school from Spell Focus by +1 DC.
tooltip.spell-descriptor: Apply bonuses for spells with the chosen descriptors.
tooltip.token: Apply bonuses for actions while specific tokens are targeted. When this buff is activated, a dialog will show up that allows you to choose from tokens in the scene.
tooltip.token-invert: Invert the selection, meaning bonuses will apply when any token is targeted that is not the chosen token.
tooltip.versatile-performance: Replace two skills with a chosen perform skill.
tooltip.versatile-performance-expanded: Select a third skill to associate with the selected Perform skill.
tooltip.versatile-training: Use BAB instead of ranks for two skills associated with a weapon group.
tooltip.versatile-training-selected: These skills will use your BAB for their ranks.
tooltip.vital-strike: Extra damage on attack actions based on weapon's damage.
tooltip.vital-strike-mythic: When using a Vital Strike feat, also include any other bonus that would normally be multiplied on a critical hit.
tooltip.vital-strike-enabled: Whether or not Vital Strike should be checked by default in attack dialogs.
tooltip.weapon-focus: +1 bonus on attack rolls for chosen weapon type. Attacks and Weapons must be properly configured with Equipment Base Types.
tooltip.weapon-focus-greater: Further increase attack roll for a chosen weapon type from Weapon Focus by +1.
tooltip.weapon-group: Apply bonuses when using weapons from chosen Weapon Group(s). Attacks and Weapons must be properly configured with weapon groups.
tooltip.weapon-group-override: Adds Weapon Groups to an Item that normally can't have one.
tooltip.weapon-specialization: +2 to damage rolls for chosen weapon type. Attacks and Weapons must be properly configured with Equipment Base Types.
tooltip.weapon-specialization-greater: Further increase damage for a weapon type chosen for Weapon Specialization by +2.
tooltip.weapon-focus-racial: +1 bonus on attack rolls for chosen racial weapons. The weapon must be tagged with the race to be able to apply the bonus.
tooltip.weapon-type: Apply bonuses when using the chosen Weapon. Attacks and Weapons must be properly configured with Equipment Base Types.
tooltip.weapon-type-override: Adds a Weapon Type to an Item that normally can't have one. This is equivalent to a weapon's Equipment Base Type.
tooltip.weapon: Choose specific Attacks and Weapons for bonuses.
tooltip.when-active: Apply bonuses when specified Buff/Weapon/Feat/etc is active.
tooltip.when-in-combat: Active when this actor is in combat.

actor.description: The global bonuses that the GM has enabled for this world. Each setting can be individually disabled here if it is not suitable for this particular actor.
actor.disable: Disable Global Bonuses for this Actor

warning.range-increment-error-plural: The farthest target ({distance}{units}) is outside of your maximum range ({max}{units}).
warning.range-increment-error-singular: The target ({distance}{units}) is outside of your maximum range ({max}{units}).
warning.require-melee-threaten-plural: You do not threaten at least one of the targets.
warning.require-melee-threaten-singular: You do not threaten the target.

application.description: This attempts to automate global bonuses that are tedious to do manually. Some of these are a best-effort and should work under most circumstances, but due to their nature some will have quirks that may be unavoidable.
application.hint: Configure specific combat bonuses that can be automated. These are global combat options that are aren't meant to be configured for specific feats or abilities, but apply to everyone.
application.label: Configure Global Bonuses
application.title: Global Bonuses

higher-ground.description: Add +1 to melee attacks when made from a higher elevation.

range-increment-penalty.description: Add ranged incremental attack penalties. Enabling this also enables bonuses to modify Ranged Attack Penalties and Range Increments.
range-increment-penalty.issues: This should fully work in most circumstances. The only case I have found where it could add the wrong penalty is if a large (or larger) token is partially hidden by a wall. It could be that the visible part is farther away than the closest part. The mod  only calcuates based on the closest part of the target regardless of walls.

shoot-into-melee.description: Adds penalties for shooting into melee. This requires that you have an ally adjacent to your target, that your target has a different disposition than you and your ally, and that at least your target or your ally threatens the other (threaten requires an equipped melee weapon or nautral attack). This also adds a Specific Bonus for Precise Shot. Make sure to open the Precise Shot feat so that it's configured. This correctly takes into account size differences.
shoot-into-melee.issues: You can normally ignore this penalty (disregarding Precise Shot) if you're shooting at a creature that's engaged in melee which is large enough for you target a spot on it at least 10 feet away from your allies. I cannot take into account if those "ok-to-shoot-at-spots" are somehow not in range or not visible--if the creature is large enough, the penalty is automatically negated.

require-melee-threaten.description: Reject a melee attack if the attacker does not threaten the target. When using a melee action, this will reject the action if the target is out of range.
require-melee-threaten.issues: There may be circumstances where the GM is allowing a melee attack against a target even though it isn't in range. To bypass this, you can either skip targeting a token or check the "Ignore Melee Range" Miscellaneous checkbox in the attack dialog.

ckl-roll-bonuses.invalid-override: This does nothing for this item type—edit the item's details directly.

item-app.description: Bonuses will apply only when using the selected items. Right click on any row to open that Item's sheet for further verification.
item-app.description-actions: Bonuses will apply only when using the selected actions. Right click on any row to open that action's sheet for further verification (or header to open the item).
item-app.description-when-active: These bonuses will only be active when the targeted item is also active. For example, secondary bonuses that apply only while raging.
item-app.title: Item Selector

item-name-app.description: Various feats and abilities attempt to auto-configure themselves when they're first used. This is based off of things like its internal id or its name. Depending on how things are set up, it may not have a matching internal id. At this point it will use the name to attempt to match and see what values need to be initialized. Because this mod is currently only available in English, these settings allow you (the GM) to supply translated names that will be automatically used for configuring those feats and abilities.
item-name-app.hint: Supply translations for abilities that Roll Bonuses attempts to automatically configure when playing non-English games.
item-name-app.label: Open Config
item-name-app.title: Item Name Translation Config

tabs.specific-description: These are for bonuses that are either too specific or too broad to be a targeted bonus. Most of these are for unique abilities or feats, or are very broard and affect something more globally that doesn't fit into the "Targeted" system.
tabs.targeted-description: Targeted Bonuses require at least one bonus and at least one target.

bonuses.label: Bonuses
bonuses.tooltip: These are the various Bonuses that can be applied to your abilities.

conditional-targets.label: Conditional Targets
conditional-targets.tooltip: Conditional Targets will apply Bonuses to all applicable abilities if their specific conditions are met.

specific-bonuses.label: Specific Bonuses
specific-bonuses.tooltip: Specific Bonuses are more specific bonuses that are less configurable then generic bonuses. These are named after the specific ability they implement.

target-overrides.label: Targetable Overrides
target-overrides.tooltip: This adds data onto item types that don't normally have that data so it works with other Targets. E.g. Adding a "Ray" Weapon Type to spells so it works with Weapon Focus or adding the Finesse weapon property to an attack so it works with Weapon Finesse.

targets.label: Targets
targets.tooltip: Targets determine exactly which abilities will be affected by Bonuses.

script-call-dialog.delete-script-message:
Once this script is deleted it cannot be recovered.
Are you sure you want to delete this script?
script-call-dialog.edit-macro-message:
You are attempting to edit a referenced macro which is not owned by this item.

Modifying this macro means that you'll be editing the world's macro directly. Every other usage of this macro will be modified.

Are you sure you want to edit this macro?

inspiration.invalid-skill-tip: Must be trained to roll for free ({die})

inspiration-focused.skill-tip: Increases Inspiration die by one step

inspiration-tenacious.skill-tip: Roll an extra Inspiration die, keep the higest

target-toggle.tooltip:
Selects if the bonus targets are evaluated as a group or individually.

All: Bonuses will be applied only if all targets are matched.

Any: Bonuses will be applied if any target is matched.

versatile-performance.skill-tip: Can be used with Versatile Performance - {base} ({enabled})
versatile-performance.title: {skill} - Versatile Performance

versatile-training.description: Choose two skills to use BAB instead of their ranks.
versatile-training.skill-tip: Versatile Training - uses BAB ({bab}) instead of ranks
versatile-training.title: {skill} - Versatile Training

debug.name: Debug Mode
debug.hint: Enable this to turn on extra logging which may help in tracking down certain issues. Defaults to `false`.

elephant-in-the-room.name: Elephant in the Room
elephant-in-the-room.hint: Enable this (disabled by default) if using the optional homebrew rules known as Elephant in the Room. This will turn off the auto-configuration that forces some feats and abilities to use normal Pathfinder rules (e.g. Weapon Focus and Weapon Specialization) and allows you to customize them manually with Targets and Bonuses.

fortuneStacks.name: Fortune Stacks
fortuneStacks.hint: If true (default), multiple fortunes/misfortunes from different sources will stack. So you could potentially end up with 4d20kh. If false, then multiple fortunes/misfortunes will only go to a max of two dice. Multiple misfortune and fortunes affecting the same roll will cancel out (e.g. 3 differnt fortunes vs 2 different misfortunes means you are "more fortunate" and will be rolling with a bonus. If you have an equal number of fortune vs misfortune, then you "break even" and roll normally.)

weapon-focus-racial.name: Racial Weapon Focus
weapon-focus-racial.hint: The name of your 'Racial Spell Focus' feat. Only 'Gnome Weapon Focus' officially exists, but this allows for other racial variations. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

weapon-focus-racial-default-race.name: Racial Weapon Focus (default race)
weapon-focus-racial-default-race.hint: The default race to look for. This is to support translations without having to translate the mod.

should-auto-target-tokens.name: Automatically Target Tokens
should-auto-target-tokens.hint: When set to true and using the generic "Token Target", when the ability is enabled, the dialog will be skipped if you have tokens currently targeted and will automatically target those tokens. By default (false), the token target dialog opens with your currently targeted tokens pre-selected and you must verify those are the targets you actually want.

should-copy-flags.name: Copy Item Flags on Attack Creation
should-copy-flags.hint: When creating an Attack from a Weapon (via the "Create Attack" button to add an Attack to your Combat tab), the system does not copy over any flags from the Weapon. This means that by default any bonuses created on the weapon do not exist on Attacks created from that Weapon. Turning this on will copy those flags when creating an Attack. This only happens at creation, this will not sync any flags modified on either after the fact. Default is false.

token.gm-hint: You can see all tokens because (and names) you're the GM. Players will only be able to select tokens that are visible to them.
token.no-tokens: There are no tokens in this scene
token.player-hint: Any currently targeted tokens in the scene are pre-selected. You can enable a setting to skip this window and automatically use those targets.

dice.bonus: Use of skill bonuses configured directly on the item is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Configure changes directly on the source ability granting these bonuses.
dice.inspiration: Use of inspiration configured directly on the skill is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. Transition to using the Inspiration specific skills configured on the appropriate abilities.
dice.dice: Use of modifying the base dice for skills is deprecated and will be removed in a future version. See the documentation for how to configure skills for fortune/misfortune. If you have a need not covered by (mis)fortune, let me know.
